name: Another BardBarian, but more like Panthro? Is it possible? Is it awesome? Or, should I forget about it?
author: Cornflower

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
I was wondering if one could sort of combine these two and make the best of two worlds. What I'm thinking (although I lack the knowledge of game mechanics and rules) is that it would be nice to play a fairly maxed out Barbarian with say 16 lvls of Bard for that extra +5AC. Maybe that build already exists somewhere, but I haven't found it yet?

This:
death-metal-bardbarian-barbarian-16-bla ... 54991.html
and this:
panthro-the-strongest-dever-in-the-worl ... 54901.html

I was hoping someone could help me... I'd ideally like to squeeze in the following:
Blind Fight
Heavy armor
Exotic weapon (if possible)
Dev Crit (+35% bonus damage on BSK)
Bard 16/Perform 30/Lasting Inspiration
Mighty Rage (15% physical immunity/2d12 bludgeoning damage on BSK)

Sort of making a barbarian version of Valefor's Panthro, adapted to Blackstone Keep. I was looking at the Death Metal Barbarian and was thinking of making Barb20/Bard16/xxx4 on a half-orc ugly mofo, since it would fit my RP. (Half-orc kinda negates Blackguard, though, which is not good, even if I go Fighter instead which has other advantages.)

If I get the mechanics correct, you can use rage and Mighty rage at the same time, thus maxing out your STR cap at +12. This would leave all those item slots free for +CON and lots of DR of various kinds.

So, is it possible? Feasible? Fun? What sayeth you all?

Or, is it better to just go plain Barbarian/Bard/RDD? But that feels so... common...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: It can not be done for the simple reason that going with Barbarian as main class would left him dry in epic levels & he would have to use his general feats to take the mandatory (EWF, EP, AS, OC, DC, TR) therefore not having enough of them to boost his strength to absurd levels. And Lasting Inspiration requires the full 20 Bard levels, not just 16 of them.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Darn. Well, in any case, thank you for the super-swift reply.

Then, if I can't have Lasting inspiration, I don't need bard. Hmm.... I'll meditate on this for a while....

Valerfor is correct in that Lasting Impression requires you to be an Epic Bard (ie lvl 21+), and Mighty Rage requires Epic Barbarian (ie lvl 21+), having both feats is impossible as there are only 40 levels.

That being said I think your class combo Barb 20/Bard 16 could work, but you may need to go Barb 21/Bard 16/other class 3 to access Mighty rage. I understand Bard Song at level 16 is pretty reasonable, and you may want curse song as well. 

Just remember having a whilst a +4 strength item and mighty rage will reach the Str cap, using a Bull's Strength potion or spell/scroll from Bard plus mighty rage will also help you reach the Str cap as well, using both rages is probably unnecessary

The remaining levels could be prestige classes (which avoid 20% exp penalty) such as CoT for extra feats and saves, Assassin for death attacks / use poison / skills, or Blackguard (which would provide Heavy Armor Proficiency and 1d6 sneak attack, use poison and stackable Bull's strength), or if you can live with the 20% exp penalty (which I understand is less of a problem on PWs where monsters respawn) then Fighter / Rogue are also good options.  

I think you are aware of Kamiryn's character builder calculator? It is an excellent tool to help with building. https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... ulator-cbc I have found it very helpful as a tool. Initially I started building without it (creating the builds in-game with Pretty Good Character Creator Module) and it was very painfully slow

I think your next step should be to settle the classes you want to use, and how many levels of each you would like, the feats you want to take remembering non humans get 14 general feats, the skills you want to take etc, attribute distribution...

I hope my response helps

Addit: I think you've written two more responses while I've been typing this - I can sense your excitement! Bard gives you UMD, Spellcraft AND Tumble as class skills... plus more...

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
I'm sort of stuck with Barbarian28, Bard2 and RDD10. I can get it to AB/AC: 45/22 and DevCrit, Epic DR, Mighty Rage, IKD, UMD and Tumble. I can get Exotic weapon or Heavy armor in, but not both. Still, it's a solid build. I think.

I was going for something else, but I'm stuck. I can't really come up with something that works better than Barb/Bard/RDD which feels so cheesy. I even dusted off my Bard8/RDD10/WM22 in desperation (AB/AC: 50/25). Oh, well. I guess I'll go play with the Barbarian/Bard/RDD then. It's yet another RDD combo. I wish I could come up with an interesting barbarian build without going back to the RDD.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yes, that's the correct choice (although it can be done, barely, with other classes) and Barb 28/ Bard 2/ Rdd 10 will offer you the most epic feats. If you don' mind the exp penalty then you could start the same build (use your own or HOOD by Max) but using Dwarf, thus potentially gain +2 Strength at the top-end. And yes, Rdd IS cheese & that's why it's everywhere, but when you have so high expectations from a build (Dev. Crit & EDR 3 & MR & 45AB) well, nothing else will suffice.
